author: darcius
content: <@!144468805697929216> Where abouts would you be leaning on the pull/push approach for withdrawals? I can see some benefits to automatic, such as integrations into defi platforms where a human wouldn't be required to action the process and it "just happens" when the node logs out, but generally a pull method is safer and better understood among dapp developers.

author: jgm
content:
<@!405158743920345128> main reason for push is around the simplicity of ETH1/ETH2 interaction.

If ETH2 pushes withdrawals at the time they become possible it could update its own state and the push happen as some sort of notification in the consensus metadata so that ETH1 picks up on it.  If it's pull then there needs to be some way of ETH1 querying and updating ETH2 state, which seems like a harder problem to me.

This does, however, assume quite a bit about how ETH1/ETH2 interactions could occur.  I'm not particularly pushing for one method over another, but if one has simplicity (and hence time to deployment) benefits it probably makes sense to move in that direction.
